revision.text:
{{WikiProject India |class=a |importance=high |districts=yes |districts-importance=high |karnataka=yes |karnataka-importance=Top }} ==Untitled== How did Konkani became native language and not kannada..konkani people migrated from goa at the mercy of kannada ruler shivappa nayak. Some body should explain how the name kannada came ?? i hate fooling public in wiki pages — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/68.84.47.224|68.84.47.224]] ([[User talk:68.84.47.224|talk]]) 23:58, 6 July 2011 (UTC) As Dakshina Kannada has been split into two districts, does it not make sense to separate out a [[Tulu Nadu]] article concerning both Dakshina Kannada and Udupi districts? [[User:QuartierLatin1968|QuartierLatin]] [[User talk:QuartierLatin1968|''1968'']] 18:45, 8 December 2005 (UTC) :I think so. [[User:Tom Radulovich|Tom Radulovich]] 18:49, 8 December 2005 (UTC) == Vandalism == I think this page should be protected for prevention of editing by unregistered users. A person is hell bent on puting hindi and degrading english & kannada. --[[User:Crazysoul|Crazysoul]] 03:13, 10 September 2007 (UTC) == Suratkal- Mangalore == Is it necessary to mention Suratkal as a separate town as it is part of Mangalore city now? ==Article name== The article now contains the word 'district' which is superfluous. There is nothing to confuse it with, and it is not used in outside use, not even in the article. The name is not in accordance with [[WP:name]] and there is no convention that it be named thus. The fact that most districts are named after an urban area and hence have to be disambiguated by the postfix does not mean that it is a standard that has to be adhered to when not necessary. The article was moved from Dakshina Kannada without discussion. I am therefore moving it back. [[User:Imc|Imc]] ([[User talk:Imc|talk]]) 18:17, 18 November 2011 (UTC) == Udupi - a part of Tulunadu == Udupi is very much a part of Tulunadu. I feel that this should be corrected. [[User:Kpbolumbu|Kpbolumbu]] ([[User talk:Kpbolumbu|talk]]) 05:50, 12 July 2013 (UTC) == Please make [[Dakshina Kannada]] a Featured Article == I request the reviewers to please make [[Dakshina Kannada]], a Featured Article on Wikipedia. [[User:Simple-man-everyday|Simple-man-everyday]] ([[User talk:Simple-man-everyday|talk]]) 02:42, 17 May 2015 (UTC) ==Assessment comment== {{Substituted comment|length=90|lastedit=20080621113642|comment=South Canara included Dakshina Kannada and udupi dists. and is not Dakshina Kannada alone.}} Substituted at 12:41, 29 April 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Dakshina Kannada]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=728302824 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Corrected formatting/usage for http://www.hindu.com/mp/2006/12/09/stories/2006120901650100.htm When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 14:10, 4 July 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:6|one external link|6 external links}} on [[Dakshina Kannada]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=730814891 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20131019160532/http://2010.census.gov/2010census/data/apportionment-pop-text.php to http://2010.census.gov/2010census/data/apportionment-pop-text.php *Added archive http://www.webcitation.org/65ESWCvkF to http://www.daijiworld.com/chan/exclusive_arch.asp?ex_id=726 *Added archive http://web.archive.org/web/20090225142615/http://www.nhai.org/Doc/project-offer/Highways.pdf to http://www.nhai.org/Doc/project-offer/Highways.pdf *Added archive http://www.webcitation.org/65EU5GBXd to http://www.hindu.com/mp/2007/08/11/stories/2007081150880400.htm *Added archive http://www.webcitation.org/65ESWCvkF to http://www.daijiworld.com/chan/exclusive_arch.asp?ex_id=726 *Added archive http://www.webcitation.org/66BGiDD1H to http://www.hindu.com/2006/08/31/stories/2006083118290300.htm When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 08:07, 21 July 2016 (UTC) ==Tulu is not an official language of Dakshina Kannada district== Tulu is a regional language of Dakshina Kannada district. It is not an official language of this district.
[[User:Simple-man-everyday|Simple-man-everyday]] ([[User talk:Simple-man-everyday|talk]]) 15:37, 24 August 2016 (UTC) =='Tulu Nadu' is not an official region of Karnataka== Tulu Nadu is not an officially recognized region of Karnataka. Dakshina Kannada is part of Coastal Karnataka (Kanara) region along with Udupi district and Uttara Kannada
[[User:Simple-man-everyday|Simple-man-everyday]] ([[User talk:Simple-man-everyday|talk]]) 15:40, 24 August 2016 (UTC)
